snippet: The case is opening as the question of prosecuting cultural destruction has been pushed to the forefront by attacks on cultural and religious sites in Iraq and Syria.
abstract: Ahmad al-Faqi al-Mahdi of Mali appears before International Criminal Court, first time a radical Islamist has been formally accused of destroying ancient religious monuments, action viewed as war crime; prosecution says Mahdi is member of Ansar Dine, organization of Al Qaeda-linked Islamic extremists and that he played prominent role in group's deliberate destruction of ancient religious structures in Timbuktu in 2012.
lead_paragraph: The case is opening as the question of prosecuting cultural destruction has been pushed to the forefront by attacks on cultural and religious sites in Iraq and Syria.

headline.main: Global Court Takes Up Case of Cultural Crimes in Mali
